CatDescriptText: Cutline of unedited image (without woman standing on left) published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 3, 1973, pg. 21, reads: "Join-in Memorial Tribute - A fitting tribute to the life and works of the late Albert J. Charles took place in funeral chapel which he founded on Bedford Ave. on a recent Sunday evening, to mark the first anniversary of his death. Pictured above are some of the key participants and members of the Charles Funeral Home staff.  Seated left to right, Mrs. Lillian Sanders, Mrs. Ora McKnight, Mrs. Marie Charles, widow and funeral director now in charge; Mrs. Thelma Gooden, mortician and Mrs. Ruby Rucker.  Alfred Turner, standing third from left is Mrs. Charles brother.  Others, reading from the left are Fred Sherrod, Lee hall and Cary Perry, students on the staff. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Copy of photograph of group portrait, seated from left: Lillian Sanders, Ora McKnight, Marie Charles, Thelma Gooden, Ruby Rucker; standing: unknown woman, Fred Sherrod, Lee Hall, Alfred Turner, and Cary Perry, posed in Charles Funeral Home
